elements.title: teleseme (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that hotel guests in the 1890s could use a teleseme (example pictured) to order cocktails and call manservants?

elements.title: Ladislav Burlas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ladislav Burlas, a musicologist at the Slovak Academy of Sciences for almost 40 years, wrote more than 150 works during his career?

elements.title: Lunar Traverse Gravimeter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Lunar Traverse Gravimeter's primary accelerometer was based on those operational on SM-65 Atlas intercontinental ballistic missiles?

elements.title: Bell Tea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bell Tea, founded in 1898, is the oldest tea company in New Zealand?

elements.title: a team of Canadian All-Stars (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in one year, a team of Canadian All-Stars twice played against the U.S. college football national champion and came within one point of winning each game?

elements.title: Ahmad Nasuhi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ahmad Nasuhi ordered a subordinate to attack the Indonesian Communist Party's offices with grenades as "psychological warfare against the central government"?

elements.title: Van Tran Flat Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Van Tran Flat Bridge was restored in 1984 using original construction techniques from the 1860s?

elements.title: George E. Mylonas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George E. Mylonas visited Mycenae at night to speak to the legendary king Agamemnon?

elements.title: Waluigi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Waluigi inspired the name of a phenomenon in artificial intelligence known as the Waluigi effect?
